illnessDescription: Amyloidosis is a group of diseases in which abnormal proteins, known as amyloid fibrils, build up in tissue.
illnessSymptoms: Weight loss, fatigue, macroglossia, neuropathy

illnessDescription: Hyperlipidemia is abnormally elevated levels of any or all lipids or lipoproteins in the blood.
illnessSymptoms: Elevated LDL, elevated total cholesterol, xanthelasma

illnessDescription: Salmonellosis is a symptomatic infection caused by bacteria of the Salmonella type.
illnessSymptoms: Diarrhea, fever, abdominal cramps, nausea

illnessDescription: Legionnaires' disease or legionellosis is a form of atypical pneumonia caused by any type of Legionella bacteria.
illnessSymptoms: Cough, shortness of breath, fever, myalgia, headache, nausea

illnessDescription: Herpes simplex is a viral infection caused by the herpes simplex virus.
illnessSymptoms: Blisters, sore throat, bell's palsy, myalgia, fever

illnessDescription: Hepatitis C is an infectious disease caused by the hepatitis C virus (HCV) that primarily affects the liver.
illnessSymptoms: Fever, dark urine, abdominal pain, jaundice

illnessDescription: Epilepsy is a group of neurological disorders characterized by recurrent epileptic seizures.
illnessSymptoms: Seizures, aura, jacksonian march

illnessDescription: Major depressive disorder (MDD), also known simply as depression, is a mental disorder characterized by at least two weeks of low mood that is present across most situations.
illnessSymptoms: Anhedonia, fatigue, avolition, appetite changes

illnessDescription: Melioidosis is an infectious disease caused by a gram-negative bacterium called Burkholderia pseudomallei.
illnessSymptoms: Fever, pneumonia, bacteremia, abscess

illnessDescription: Acute glomerulonephritis comprises a specific set of renal diseases in which an immunologic mechanism triggers inflammation and proliferation of glomerular tissue that can result in damage to the basement membrane, mesangium, or capillary endothelium.
illnessSymptoms: Hematuria, proteinuria, hypertension, edema, lower abdominal pain

illnessDescription: Type 2 diabetes is a form of diabetes that is characterized by high blood sugar, insulin resistance, and relative lack of insulin.
illnessSymptoms: Polydipsia, polyuria, polyphagia, unexplained weight loss

illnessDescription: Atherosclerosis is a disease in which the inside of an artery narrows due to the buildup of plaque.
illnessSymptoms: Angina, myocardial infarction, fatigue, dizziness, arrhythmias, sweating, shortness of breath

illnessDescription: Chronic pain is pain that lasts a long time. The pain may be be caused by inflammation or dysfunctional nerves.
illnessSymptoms: Pain, drug addiction, depression, suicidal ideation

illnessDescription: Peripheral neuropathy is a general term describing disease affecting the peripheral nerves, meaning nerves beyond the brain and spinal cord.
illnessSymptoms: Tremor, numbness, tingling, loss of equilibrium, itching, gait abnormalities, pain, depression

illnessDescription: Sarcoidosis is a disease involving abnormal collections of inflammatory cells that form lumps known as granulomas.
illnessSymptoms: Weakness, cough, dry eyes, arthritis, dry cough

illnessDescription: Rickettsialpox is a mite-borne infectious illness caused by bacteria of the genus Rickettsia (Rickettsia akari).
illnessSymptoms: Eschars, fever, chills, weakness, myalgia, rash

illnessDescription: Hypothyroidism is a disorder of the endocrine system in which the thyroid gland does not produce enough thyroid hormone.
illnessSymptoms: Fatigue, bradycardia, depression, weight gain, hyperlipidemia, goiter

illnessDescription: Graves' disease, also known as toxic diffuse goiter, is an autoimmune disease that affects the thyroid and causes hyperthyroidism.
illnessSymptoms: Myopathy, insomnia, exophthalmos, pretibial myxedema, irritability

illnessDescription: Malaria is a mosquito-borne parasitic infectious disease that affects humans and other animals.
illnessSymptoms: Jaundice, seizures, fever, fatigue, nausea, headache

illnessDescription: Parkinson's disease is a long-term degenerative disorder of the central nervous system that mainly affects the motor system, caused by the death of dopaminergic neurons.
illnessSymptoms: Tremor, rigidity, hypokinesia, gait abnormality, dementia
